title: Ninth Island NV Sparkling Rosé Sparkling (Tasmania)
description: Ninth Island is the second label of the well-respected Piper's Brook, and its fizz is made by Natalie Fryar, the winemaker behind Jansz. This pink sparkler is made from Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier. Delicate notes of yeast, green apple, strawberry and watermelon rind are woven into a palate that's creamy in texture but buoyed by a bright line of acidity and lively bubbles.

title: Novy 2015 G-S-M (Sonoma Valley)
description: This blends 36% Syrah, 23% Mourvèdre, 22% Viognier and 19% Grenache. A beautiful perfume of violet opens the proceedings, followed by white pepper, garrigue, lavender and meat. A high-toned midpalate tames the wine's richer, riper leanings that takes on a robust taste of strawberry leather before pepper comes back to dot the finish.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is all about fresh, tangy and grassy fruit. With a distinct texture and strong minerality, it is tight and needs to age. It comes from one of the top vineyards in Sancerre. Drink from 2020.

title: Pflüger 2017 Quarzit Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Pfalz)
description: An intensely aromatic, invigorating wine with notes of freshly cut grass, lime zest and smoke. The palate is fresh and pristine, offering loads of cutting gooseberry and lime flavors. Offers all the vibrant fruit of New World Sauvignon Blanc but is more sprightly and mineral in character.

title: Pommery NV Brut Apanage  (Champagne)
description: This bottling has some age to it, giving a toasty wine with a crisp texture. Nearly four years before disgorging has given it a mature sheen that has balanced the ripe fruit and enhanced a more mineral element. Drink now.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2016 Margem Red (Douro)
description: From vertical vineyards that run straight up the hillside, an innovation in the mountainous Douro, this ripe blend of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca is rich in tannins as well as black fruits. It has a firm texture that boasts a black plum flavor, bright acidity and a hint of wood aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta S. Joao Batista 2015 Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Tejo)
description: This stylish wine shows the quality of the two grapes in the blend. They both contribute perfumed black fruits and rich tannins that give this powerful wine both density and concentration. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.

title: Richard Hamilton 2016 Little Road Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This plump, juicy wine offers notes of blueberry, plum, milk chocolate and cracked black pepper. The fruit on the palate is ripe but well balanced by chewy, savory tannins and a meaty, peppery finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Royal Punishers Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Brown sugar, red berry, lavender and a touch of heat mark this velvety thick and smoothly tannic wine, a hearty showcase of the variety. Complex and interwoven in oak, it finishes in bits of black and white pepper.

title: Schild Estate 2015 Moorooroo Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: This is an open, savory Shiraz from vines planted in 1847. Intriguing notes of soy sauce, rare beef and a strong vegetal component are more in focus than the plummy fruit. The palate is supple in feel, with taut, grainy tannins. Drink now–2028.

title: Sketchbook 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This is a delicious and substantial wine that emphasizes subtlety and structure, while slowly revealing fruity, spicy and savory elements with each sip. It has reserved pear and almond aromas that carry to a palate accented by ripe peach, vanilla and cream. The texture is viscous and holds everything together.

title: Stoller 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a lightly minty, fruity and forward wine of medium concentration. Aging in 30% new French oak brings up sweet baking spices around blueberry and cherry fruit. Drinking well already, it should improve through 2024.

title: Talisman 2014 Adastra Vineyard Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Exotic in aroma and grainy in texture, this tiny-production wine excites in its thick layers of crisp and crunchy tang of fruit, which spans from pomegranate to wild strawberry to boysenberry. Layers of cola add a richness that trails on the finish.

title: Terredora Di Paolo 2012 Fatica Contadina  (Taurasi)
description: Underbrush, mature black-skinned fruit and culinary spice aromas lead the nose. The dense palate offers dried blackberry, prune, licorice and powdered sage set against close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Viaggio 2014 The President Merlot (Lodi)
description: Touches of dried herbs and black olives in the aromas and flavors give an authentic appeal to this full-flavored and full-bodied wine. A hint of spicy oak enhances the experience but doesn't overwhelm the fruity, savory aspects that are so enjoyable.

title: Jean Laurent 2006 Blanc de Blancs Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This crisp, textured wine still offers great freshness. Its acidity and taut white fruits are zesty, hinting at toastiness and with a fine texture. It is an elegant wine, ready to drink.

title: Niner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling from the extremely coastal Jespersen Ranch shows what a truly cool climate can do for Sauvignon Blanc. It's tightly woven but approachable on the nose, with aromas of honeydew, kiwi and wet stone. The palate is incredibly zippy, offering chalky flavors of apple and pear. A lime rind tartness holds the finish.

title: Voirin-Jumel NV Grand Brut Brut Zéro Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: As its name indicates, this is a bone-dry wine. Richness counterbalances the dryness, delivering ripe white fruits, intense citrus as well as a intensely mineral texture. Drink this bottling now.
designation: Grand Brut Brut Zéro Blanc de Blancs

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2015 Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: This is a ripe, smoky wine, with soft tannins and swathes of red fruits. It is still young, with a stalky character, but it will fill out as it matures because the weight and the tannins are very present. Drink from 2020. It is named after a mistress of King Charles VII of France.

title: Lallier NV Grand Rosé Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Made of a blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, all from Grand Cru vineyards, this wine is balanced, with a tight texture as well as ripe berry fruits. Its acidity and minerality are balanced by the richness of the wine and its generous aftertaste. Drink now.
